item.description: Fatal Traffic Collision; INC#1946; 11:59PM; EB 118 Fwy x San Diego Fwy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Mm0JaL; #GranadaHills; PRELIM: Two vehicle traffic collision with fire. Four patients total: Three persons (no details) within one burnt vehicle, all deceased at scene. Another person (unknown age / gender / condition ) from the other vehicle (unknown if involved with fire), taken by LAFD Paramedics to an area hospital. No further details. Media Inquiries: CHP West Valley (Log #3820) and Coroner. ; FS 87; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; E275 E7 E87 RA87 T75; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Fatal Traffic Collision; INC#1736; 09:34PM; 7600 N Winnetka Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3FLEQPz; #Winnetka; One person deceased at scene (unknown age / gender / affiliation / circumstances). title.a: Update Greater Alarm Brush Fire #LopezCanyonFire 05/14/2022 INC#1313

item.description: Update #LopezCanyonFire Greater Alarm Brush Fire; INC#1313; 09:00PM; 12031 N Lopez Canyon Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DVayIr; #LakeViewTerrace; A detailed hiking survey of the fireline now shows that 8.29 acres of vegetation has burned, and the blaze is 90% contained with no visible flame. LAFD Paramedics assisted one adult male civilian who became suddenly ill near the fireline. He has been taken to an area hospital in undetermined condition. No other injuries have been reported. 50 LAFD Firefighters are currently assigned to the incident, which will remain in an active patrol status through the night. The cause of the fire remains under investigation.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 BC10 BC12 BP19 BP74 CE83 E15 E24 E275 E29 E290 E298 E35 E77 E87 E89 E90 E91 E98 EM14 H2 H3 H4 HA2 HA3 HA4 RA74 RA87 RA90 RA91 RA98 RT83 T75 T90 T98 WT77 + LACoFD + ANF; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Greater Alarm Brush Fire #LopezCanyonFire 05/14/2022 INC#1313

item.description: Update #LopezCanyonFire Greater Alarm Brush Fire; INC#1313; 06:38PM; 12031 N Lopez Canyon Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DVayIr; #LakeViewTerrace; The fire remains within LAFD jurisdiction, held at a little over four (4) acres of light grass and medium brush in steep terrain near the Lopez Canyon Landfill. The blaze is now 60% contained. No injuries have been reported. Firefighters will remain at scene tonight to check for hotspots, extinguish smoldering debris and further contain the fire's perimeter. The cause of the fire is still under investigation. LAFD Public Information Officer (PIO) Captain Cody Weireter is en route to the Command Post at Lopez Canyon Road and Paxton Street, ETA 7:30 PM.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 BC10 BC12 BP74 CE83 E24 E275 E290 E298 E77 E87 E89 E90 E91 E98 EM14 H2 H3 H4 HA2 HA3 HA4 RA74 RA87 RA90 RA91 RA98 T75 T90 T98 WT77 + LACoFD _ ANF; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Greater Alarm Brush Fire Controlled - #LopezCanyonFire 05/14/2022 INC#1313

item.description: Update Controlled - #LopezCanyonFire Greater Alarm Brush Fire; INC#1313; 06:21PM; 12031 N Lopez Canyon Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DVayIr; #LakeViewTerrace; A well coordinated ground and air response by 69 LAFD personnel, LACoFD and ANF has taken just 55 minutes to stop forward progress of the fire at four (4) acres of light grass and medium brush in steep terrain near the Lopez Canyon Landfill. No injury. No structure damage. No evacuation. Firefighters will remain at scene tonight to extinguish smoldering debris and fully contain the fire's perimeter. The fire remains within City of Los Angeles (LAFD) jurisdiction. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 BC10 BC12 BP74 E24 E275 E290 E298 E77 E87 E89 E90 E91 E98 EM14 H2 H3 H4 HA2 HA3 HA4 RA90 RA91 T75 T90 T98 WT77 + LACoFD + ANF; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#1313; 05:26PM; 12031 N Lopez Canyon Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3DVayIr; #LakeViewTerrace; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response with LACoFD and ANF to as many as four (4) acres of light grass and medium brush burning uphill with light wind near Lopez Canyon Landfill, slow rate of spread. No structure threat. No evacuation.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 BC10 BC12 BP74 E24 E275 E290 E298 E77 E87 E89 E90 E91 E98 EM14 H2 H3 H4 HA2 HA3 HA4 RA91 T75 T90 T98 WT77 + LACoFD + ANF; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

Public / Media Advisory; 10:45PM; #GranadaHills / #PorterRanch; The cause of this evening's two brush fires alongside the eastbound Ronald Reagan (SR118) Freeway between Hayvenhurst Avenue (LAFD Incident #1853) and Reseda Boulevard (LAFD Incident #1841) are connected, and considered to be incendiary in nature. Eyewitnesses informed the California Highway Patrol (West Valley Log #3318) that one or more persons were seen discharging fireworks from a black van. Anyone with information regarding the suspect(s) is encouraged to notify law enforcement anonymously via Crimestoppers by calling 1-800-222-TIPS.; - Brian Humphrey

Update Brush Fire; INC#1853; 09:50PM; EB 118 Fwy x Hayvenhurst Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wolwUt; #GranadaHills; Despite erratic wind with embercast, 73 LAFD ground-based Firefighters took just one hour to stop forward progress of this fire, holding it to (yet to be determined size) brush, grass and trees adjacent to the eastbound lanes of the Ronald Reagan Freeway near Hayvenhurst Avenue. No injury. No structures damaged. Firefighters will remain at scene to continue containment and overhaul. This fire is under investigation. There is *presently* no correlation determined between this fire, and a concurrent brush fire that burned to the west near Reseda Blvd (LAFD Incident #1841).; FS 18; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC12 BC14 CM42 E100 E103 E106 E18 E24 E287 E290 E75 E83 E84 E93 EM15 H2 H4 H5 HA2 HA4 HA5 RA18 T87 T90; CH5; 13; Brian Humphrey

Update Brush Fire; INC#1841; 09:45PM; EB 118 Fwy x Reseda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3N8uqMk; #PorterRanch; Despite a 10 mph wind with embercast, 74 LAFD ground-based Firefighters took just one hour to stop forward progress of the fire, holding it to (yet to be determined size) brush adjacent to the eastbound lanes of the Ronald Reagan Freeway. No injury. No structures damaged. Firefighters will remain at scene to continue containment and overhaul. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 8; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 BC17 E103 E104 E106 E28 E287 E290 E296 E70 E87 EM17 H5 HA5 RA107 RA90 T87 T90 T96; CH5; 18; Brian Humphrey
